Detailed Description

Implements a family of linear regressions (over a set of quantitative variables), indexed by a set of categorical variables.

Actually, given a categorical variable (or conjunction of variables) with a cardinality of , this class constructs and learns a set of linear regressions (see plLearnLinearRegression).

See Also
plLearnLinearRegression

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

plLearnLinearRegressionFamily::plLearnLinearRegressionFamily ( const plSymbol &  left_var,
const plVariablesConjunction &  quantitative_right_vars,
const plVariablesConjunction &  categorical_right_vars,
plFloat  regression_std_deviation = -PL_ONE,
plFloat  inv_threshold = 0.001 
)

Constructor.

Parameters
[in]left_varThe regression quantitative output variable
[in]quantitative_right_varsThe right (parent) quantitative variables on which the regression is computed
[in]categorical_right_varsThe right (parent) categorical variables for which we have a regression for each modality
[in]regression_std_deviationthe standart deviation to be used around the regression value. If -1, the residual error will be used.
[in]inv_thresholdThe threshold used for Greville's algorithm used for matrix inversion

Member Function Documentation

plCndDistribution plLearnLinearRegressionFamily::get_cnd_distribution ( ) const
virtual

Constructs the corresponding learnt conditional distribution.

It computes the vector for each regression and returns a plDistributionTable of plLinearRegression.

Implements plLearnCndObject.

unsigned int plLearnLinearRegressionFamily::get_n_parameters ( ) const
virtual

Returns the ACTUAL number of parameters.

It could be different from the number of parameters returned by get_parameters.

For example, the actual number of parameters of a N dimensional normal distribution is N + N*(N+1)/2 because the covariance matrix is symmetric.

Implements plLearnObject.
